org.silex.runtime.geom.Matrix

type
class
This class is an implementation of a 3x3 matrix. It is meant to be cross-platform and as such doesn't rely on any runtime specific API. It exposes method to create and manipulate a matrix which can then be used to apply 2d transformations to a display object.

Constructor

new(?matrixData : MatrixData)
Class constructor. Creates a 3x3 matrix with the given parameters. It defaults to an identity matrix (no transformations), if the given matrix data are null.

Instance Methods

concatenate(matrix : Matrix) : Void

parameters
matrix the matrix to concatenate with the current matrix
Concatenate the matrix values by multiplying them.

getMatrixData() : MatrixData

returns
the 6 values of this 3x3 matrix
Return this matrix data

getRotation() : Int

return an estimation of the current matrix rotation in degree. This method assumes that the matrix has not been skewed

getScaleX() : Float

Return the current X scale of the matrix

getScaleY() : Float

Return the current Y scale of the matrix

getSkewX() : Float

Return the current x skew of the matrix

getSkewY() : Float

Return the current y skew of the matrix

getTranslationX() : Float

Return the current X translation of the matrix

getTranslationY() : Float

Return the current Y translation of the matrix

identity() : Void

Reset the matrix to an identity matrix (no transformations)

rotate(angle : Int, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
angle the rotation angle in degree
transformationOrigin the pivot point
Apply a transformation rotating the matrix of the angle number of degree (clockwise), using "transformationOrigin" as rotation center.

scale(scaleX : Float, scaleY : Float, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
scaleX horizontal scale factor
scaleY vertical scale factor
transformOrigin the scale center
Apply a transformation scaling the matrix by the "scaleX" and "scaleY" factor, using "transformationOrigin" as scaling center.

setMatrixData(matrixData : MatrixData) : Void

parameters
contains 6 values
Set the values of this 3x3 matrix, fall back to an identity matrix if null

setRotation(angle : Int, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
angle the angle that must be applied
transformationOrigin the rotation center
Set the rotation of the matrix to an absolut value instead of adding a rotation to an existing rotation. Preserve the existing transformations

setScaleX(scaleXFactor : Float, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
scaleXFactor the target scale x
transformationOrigin the scale center
Set the absolut scale x value instead of adding it to the current scale x value

setScaleY(scaleYFactor : Float, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
scaleXFactor the target scale y
transformationOrigin the scale center
Set the absolut scale y value instead of adding it to the current scale y value

setTranslationX(translationX : Float) : Void

parameters
translationX the target x translation
Set the absolut x translation instead of adding it to the current x translation

setTranslationY(translationY : Float) : Void

parameters
translationY the target y translation
Set the absolut y translation instead of adding it to the current y translation

skew(skewX : Float, skewY : Float, transformationOrigin : Point) : Void

parameters
skewX the horizontal skew factor
skewY the vertical skew factor
transformOrigin the skew center
Apply a transformation skewing the matrix by the "skewX" and "skewY" factor, using "transformationOrigin" as skewing center.

translate(x : Float, y : Float) : Void

parameters
x the translation along the x axis
y the translation along the y axis
Apply a transformation translating the matrix with the given x and y offsets.
